response.original_title: What is Norton on a bank statement? ((Get~Help))
response.overview: Call (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) if you see "DR*Norton" or "NortonLifeLock" on your bank statement. You may (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) see "PAYPAL *NORTON" if you used a third-party wallet for payment. Simply dial (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) to clarify charges labeled with a series of letters and numbers like "AP##########." An agent (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) can explain why your statement shows a higher price than your initial purchase. If you (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) notice "Norton Utilities" or "Norton VPN," it may be a separate standalone service charge. Always contact (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) if the descriptor is unfamiliar to ensure it isn't a fraudulent charge. Most users (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) get their refund within 10 days once the charge is identified and canceled.
response.title: What is Norton on a bank statement? ((Get~Help))
